results.title: Fitness for sport
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sports training film series”.
This film shows how to attain the basic physical fitness which all sportsmen need for success - whatever their sport. More than fifty exercises are demonstrated and a squad of athletes is taken through a training session devised by a former Polish Olympic athlete to develop mobility, elastic strength and endurance. Written and narrated by Ron Pickering.

results.title: Fitness for living: how to get fit
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Educational Media Company and Eric Horter
results.brief_description: This film shows ways of getting fit and suggests that regular practice of specific exercises is the key to developing strength and endurance; that slow continuous exercise such as jogging or bicycling develops the heart and lungs; that weight training augments muscle strength. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Fit to fight
results.creator_credit: R.H.R. Productions, Army Kinema Corporation, Ronald H. Riley and Gordon Stewart
results.brief_description: The physical training of the British Army, showing how it is carefully planned to help every recruit to reach his own individual peak of fitness. Explains the necessity for this high standard of physical well-being by showing how the training relates to different activities in the field.

results.title: Fit For the Future
results.creator_credit: Physical Education Branch, Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: Shows the range of physical education activities provided in Victorian primary schools. Running, jumping, folk dancing, tumbling, team games and swimming are all encouraged so as to develop physical potential.

results.title: Fists in the pocket = I pugni in tasca
results.creator_credit: Doria Film, Enzo Doria and Marco Bellocchio
results.brief_description: This bizarre drama chronicles the strange activities of a blind widow living with her four children - Augusto, Sandro, Leone and Giulia. The burden of supporting the family falls on Augusto, the only one of the four not afflicted with epilepsy. When Sandro determines to help Augusto break away and marry his girlfriend, he can see only one way to do it; and sets out to kill the rest of his family. Accompanied by a powerful film score by Ennio Morricone. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Fishtank
results.creator_credit: Super Fresh Oyster Films, Queensland University of Technology, Denis Quinn and Marie-Louise Simpson
results.brief_description: An adult reflects on a time in his youth when he used to wait for his father at the Regatta Hotel in Queensland during the sixties. It was a time when the muffled mutterings at the bar concerned issues such as women, pictures, and what it meant to be part of the “lucky country”. It was a men’s club, one legally and morally off limits to women, until 2 of them enter the bar, and, after being evicted handcuff themselves to the bar as a form of protest. Based on a true event and narrated by Daniel Rowan. Cast includes Dave Robinson, Damien Donowan, Stephen Collins, Liesel Badorrek and Kyrra Mickelborough.

results.title: Fishing the lake country
results.creator_credit: Pilgrim Films, Australian Broadcasting Commission, Betti Wood and Ossie Emery
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Fisherman’s World”.
Ron Calcutt shows some attractive fishing spots in Sydney and Mallacoota before going to the Gippsland Lakes. All through the film he gives hints on fishing, as well as discussing the ups and downs of the sport.

results.title: Fishing on the coast of Japan
results.creator_credit: International Film Foundation and Julien Bryan
results.brief_description: Depicts the rigorous existence of Japanese fisherman. This film is non-narrated with Japanese music serving as the background. Shows the preparation of the nets, men and women pulling the boats into the sea, look outs for fish, the final catch, return home and the unloading. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
